title: demons
comment: Evil spiritual forces; Scripture stresses the reality of demonic forces and recognises a number of categories to which they may be assigned. Jesus Christ's authority over such demonic forces is seen at work in his ministry and in that of his disciples.

children.title: demons, kinds of
children.comment: Scripture uses a number of terms to refer to demonic forces, stressing both their reality and hostility to God.

children.title: demons, malevolence of
children.comment: Demons are opposed to the person and work of God and seek to lead human beings, including believers, away from him. For this reason, believers are forbidden to be involved with them.

secondaryrefs.comment: the boy with an evil spirit

children.title: Demons lead people away from God
The inspiration of pagan religions by demons
Pagan gods are identified as demons
Demons inhabit ruins of pagan cities
All involvement with spirits and mediums is forbidden
Witchcraft is identified as a work of the sinful nature
Involvement with sorcery or witchcraft is futile
Examples of renunciation of the work of demons
demons, possession by
children.comment: A recognised condition in Jesus Christ's lifetime in which an individual is dominated by the influence of a demon. In his ministry, Jesus Christ encountered and delivered many people in such a condition. Many of Christ's critics unsuccessfully sought to ascribe his authority and powers to demonic possession.

children.title: Unfounded accusations of demon-possession against Jesus Christ are refuted
Jesus Christ encounters cases of multiple demon-possession and is able to deliver
Further evidence of the possibility of multiple demon-possession
Demons recognise divine authority and their own limited powers
Jesus Christ's disciples have power to release from demon-possession by calling on Jesus' name
demons, exorcism of
children.comment: Jesus Christ drove out many demons during his earthly ministry and he delegated this authority to his disciples.

children.title: Jesus Christ understood exorcism as part of his ministry
He drove out demons from individuals brought to him
He drove out demons from individuals whom he encountered
Jesus Christ had power over demons
He was able to drive demons out at a distance
He used words of rebuke to drive out demons
Jesus Christ identifies the spiritual resources needed for exorcising demons
The ministry of exorcism was an indication of the kingdom's presence
The results of being delivered from demon-possession
The impact of exorcism on those who observe it
demons, Jesus Christ's authority over
children.comment: Demons are subject to the authority of Jesus Christ during his ministry and subsequently in the ministry of the church.

children.title: All spiritual powers are subject to Jesus Christ who has supreme authority
Demons are powerless before Jesus Christ
Demons can only do what he permits
The name of Jesus Christ has power against demons
Jesus Christ's name is used by his disciples
Jesus Christ anticipates the misuse of his own name

seealsos.comment: an example where Jesus' name is used in cases of demon-possession--but not by Jesus Christ's disciples, and not successfully

children.title: Jesus Christ's disciples have delegated power over demons
In the ongoing ministry of the church
Others will attempt to drive out demons
